title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When using the Java editor, it has been observed that reverting the file contents is significantly slower compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB: When attempting to revert the file contents in the Java editor, the operation takes much longer to complete compared to closing and reopening the file.
EB: The time it takes to revert the file should be similar or even faster than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file in the editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Try to revert the file contents.
4. Observe the time it takes for the revert operation to complete.
